BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ARTS COUNCIL OF FAIRFAX COUNTY INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ARTSFAIRFAX IS DEDICATED TO EXPANDING SUPPORT FOR AND ACCESS TO ARTS AND CULTURE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL OF FAIRFAX COUNTY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ARTSFAIRFAX IS DEDICATED TO EXPANDING SUPPORT FOR AND ACCESS TO ARTS AND CULTURE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL OF FAIRFAX COUNTY.
IRS990.Desc: GRANTS - GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN VARIOUS CATEGORIES, INCLUDING (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT, PROJECT GRANTS, ARTIST GRANTS, AND AWARDS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. ARTSFAIRFAX AWARDED 56 GRANTS TO ARTS ORGANIZATIONS AND ARTISTS LOCATED IN FAIRFAX COUNTY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNICATION - ARTSFAIRFAX PROVIDES INFORMATIONAL SERVICES (WEB, NEWSLETTER, RESOURCE INFO, AND EVENTS LISTINGS) TO THE ARTS COMMUNITY, AND PROMOTES THE ARTS AND ALL ARTS ACTIVITIES IN FAIRFAX TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO CONDUCTS SURVEYS AND GATHERS DATA TO HELP THE ARTS AND CITIZENS ADVOCATE FOR SUPPORT OF THE ARTS AT THE LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL LEVELS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SERVICE PROGRAMS - ARTSFAIRFAX PROVIDES CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMS TO THE ARTS COMMUNITY SUCH AS EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDES ARTS SERVICES TO THE BROADER COMMUNITY SUCH AS THE ARTIST RESIDENCY PROGRAM IN FAIRFAX COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND THE CREATIVE AGING FESTIVAL, AS WELL AS STAFFING AND COORDINATION OF COUNTY-WIDE MASTER ARTS PLANNING FOR ARTS FACILITY INFRASTRUCTURE AND PUBLIC ART.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND NO INTEREST AND PENALTIES HAVE BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: ARTIST AWARDS AND MISC. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS - TO SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE FAIRFAX COUNTY'S FINEST CREATIVE ARTISTS IN ALL DISCIPLINES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANTS COMMITTEE PLANS AND OVERSEES EXECUTION OF THE ANNUAL GRANT MAKING. GRANTS ARE TYPICALLY DISBURSED IN TWO INSTALLMENTS, WITH THE FINAL INSTALLMENT DISBURSED AFTER THE FINAL REPORT IS DUE. THE GRANTS MANAGER AND THE GRANTS COMMITTEE ENSURE THAT THE GRANT USAGE COINCIDES WITH THE GRANT PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY WHICH EXAMINES THE RETURN AND ANY ACCOMPANYING DOCUMENTS FOR COMPLETENESS AND ACCURACY BEFORE SIGNING AND SUBMITTING THE RETURN TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, STAFF MEMBERS AND VOLUNTEERS AND IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY. ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS FROM EACH PERSON ARE MAINTAINED BY THE CHAIRMAN OR PRESIDENT/CEO AND RETAINED IN THE OFFICE OF ARTSFAIRFAX. THE ENTIRE BOARD REVIEWS EACH TRANSACTION TO COME BEFORE THE BOARD FOR POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IF POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS (PAST, PRESENT OR FUTURE) ARE IDENTIFIED, THE PERSON WHO DISCLOSES A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL OR OTHER MATERIAL INTEREST IN AN ARRANGEMENT MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AND RESPOND TO QUESTIONS BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. AS PART OF ANY SUCH PRESENTATION, THE DIRECTOR, OFFICER, STAFF MEMBERS OR VOLUNTEER SHALL PROVIDE TO THE BOARD ANY REASONS WHY THE ARRANGEMENT MIGHT BE OR NOT BE IN THE BEST INTEREST OF ARTSFAIRFAX. THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER ARTSFAIRFAX CAN OBTAIN A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS ARRANGEMENT WITH REASONABLE EFFORTS FROM A PERSON OR ENTITY THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE BOARD SHALL, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINT A DISINTERESTED PERSON OR COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE ALTERNATIVES TO THE PROPOSED ARRANGEMENT. IF A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS CONTRACT, TRANSACTION, OR ARRANGEMENT IS NOT REASONABLY ATTAINABLE UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OR INTEREST, THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE BY MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE BOARD WHETHER THE ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE ARTSFAIRFAX'S BEST INTEREST AND WHETHER IT IS FAIR AND REASONABLE TO ARTSFAIRFAX AND SHALL MAKE ITS DECISION AS TO WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE ARRANGEMENT IN CONFORMITY WITH SUCH DETERMINATION. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD WHO WORK FOR OR SIT ON THE GOVERNING BOARDS OF ORGANIZATIONS WHO RECEIVE GRANTS RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM VOTING TO APPROVE SUCH GRANTS. THE IDENTIFIED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND APPROPRIATE RECUSALS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF EACH BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST, AS INDICATED ON ALL PRINTED LITERATURE AND CONTRIBUTION ACKNOWLEDGEMENT FORMS.
